event.title: was organized by an act of the Missouri General Assembly on January 29, 1841

data.event: Although Scotland County was organized by an act of the Missouri General Assembly on January 29, 1841 the town of Memphis did not come to be until more than two years later.

event.title: did not come to be until more than two years later

data.event: Although Scotland County was organized by an act of the Missouri General Assembly on January 29, 1841 the town of Memphis did not come to be until more than two years later.

event.title: met at Sand Hill on May 15, 1843

data.event: County commissioners met at Sand Hill on May 15, 1843 to select the county seat.

event.title: was filed with county court on October 11, 1843

data.event: After being laid out in town lots the original plat of Memphis was filed with county court on October 11, 1843.

event.title: existed on the site and had for several years

data.event: However a few homes already existed on the site and had for several years, the first being a log cabin constructed in 1835 by Burton Tompkins.
However a few homes already existed on the site and had for several years, the first being a log cabin constructed in 1835 by Burton Tompkins.
